timeline.bodyText: Add documentation that says you can only call this for definitional resource types and that otherwise it will throw an IllegalArgumentException

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -143,6 +157,7 @@ public String getLatestVersion(String url, Class<? extends Resource> resourceTyp
      */

replies.bodyText: An IllegalArgumentException will not be thrown if the resource isn't definitional for this method. The method will simply return null.
replies.author: JohnTimm

timeline.bodyText: Add documentation that says you can only call this for definitional resource types and that otherwise it will throw an IllegalArgumentException

@@ -115,6 +128,7 @@ public String getLatestVersion(String url, Class<? extends Resource> resourceTyp
     public <T extends Resource> T getResource(String url, Class<T> resourceType) {

timeline.bodyText: Add documentation that says you can only call this for definitional resource types and that otherwise it will throw an IllegalArgumentException
timeline.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText: Add documentation that says you can only call this for definitional resource types and that otherwise it will throw an IllegalArgumentException
timeline.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: An IllegalArgumentException will not be thrown if the resource isn't definitional for this method. The method will simple return false.
replies.author: JohnTimm

timeline.bodyText: maybe overload the constructor to let the user pass in the cache size?
timeline.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: This is used internally and is not intended to be configured / controlled by the user.
replies.author: JohnTimm

timeline.bodyText: maybe a comment here to explain that getInstance() loads all the static providers
timeline.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText: Maybe explain that this shouldn't be called by consumers and that they should use the ServiceLoader to make their static RegistryResourceProviders available instead
timeline.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText: Was debating whether INFO level here is appropriate...we try to be very sparse with those.
timeline.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: As discussed on slack, please also make it clear we're just removing them from the cache...not from the registry or the db or something
replies.author: lmsurpre
